venue.name: Microsoft New England Research & Development Center (NERD)

item.description:
• 7:00pm - Introductions
  • 7:15pm - Talk: Shimon Rura, Judging Google AppEngine: Should you use it?
  • 8:00pm - Lightning talks: Recap of DjangoCon 2010
  • 9:00pm - Drinks and networking


Judging Google AppEngine: Should you use it?
by Shimon Rura (http://rura.org/shimo...)

AppEngine's been out for over two years. During that time it's evolved a lot, but maintained its original design goals: high scalability, easy deployment, and low pricing. Shimon Rura has worked with AppEngine since 2008, and is currently working on his most ambitious AE app to date.

Topics Shimon will cover:

  • pros & cons of building on AE
  • when you shouldn't use AE
  • how to use Django on AE
  • case study of a complex AE app
  • AE design patterns: recurring problems and solutions
  • predictions for the future of AE


Lightning talks about DjangoCon 2010
Anyone who was at DjangoCon is welcome to give a 5-10 min lightning talk about a cool app you find out about or something interesting that you learned that you want to share with the group.
item.name: Django Boston Sep 2010
